Key Arguments: The legislation is an unnecessary assault on free speech.
It assumes citizens cannot make decisions for themselves.
Bureaucrats cannot be trusted to assess speech due to potential biases.
Fact checkers are compromised by bias and cannot be independent authorities.
The legislation blurs the line between comment and fact, infringing on free expression.
Tech companies are unfairly made liable for comments on their platforms.
The government and media, major sources of misinformation, are exempt from the legislation.
The legislation could be used to suppress criticism of government actions.
Notable Quotes: This is a completely unnecessary assault on free speech.
There is no independent authority than can determine what is and what isn't bad information.
The major purveyors of mis/dis information are the Media, Government and politicians generally. Yet these are exempt!
